bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to William F. Wharton, September 19, 1890
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, September 19, 1890.
Mr Beverly Y. Payne, to the Department of State.
Transmitting account and returns for quarter ended June 30th 1890.
Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, September 19, 1890.
Honorable William F. Wharton, Assistant Secretary of State, Wasington, D. C.

Sir: I have been infromed by Mr E. E. Smith, that his official function as United States Minister and Consul General to Liberia whould cease on the 20th ult., and requested to transmit to the Department of State, his account, receipts and voucher for the quearter ended June 30th last.
I have the honor to inclose Bond of Treasury T'ese, Statement of Account and Voucher (3) and regret not being able to transmit
transmit herewith complete Returns for said quarter, as Mr. Smith was in charge the quarter period of the quarter.
I have the honor to be, Sir, your obedient Servant.
Beverly Y. Payne, U.S. Vice Consul General.
Inclosure 1. Records of Treasury Fee 2. Statement of Account and voucher 3
